name: The Scourge
description: A relentless necromantic horde that spreads death and decay across the land. The Scourge raises fallen enemies as mindless servants, creating an ever-growing army that knows no fear and requires no sustenance.
shortDescription: Necromantic undead horde - free units from corpses, disease, overwhelming numbers

lore.origin: Born from the darkest necromantic rituals, the Scourge emerged when the Lich King Ner'zhul merged his consciousness with the Frozen Throne, creating an undying army that sweeps across all living things.
lore.motivation: To convert all life into undeath, serving the eternal will of the Lich King
lore.culture: A hierarchy of death where power flows from necromantic might. The strong command the weak, and all serve the singular purpose of expanding the Scourge.

strengths.name: Corpse Economy
strengths.description: Raise free units from corpses of fallen enemies and allies

strengths.name: Disease Spreading
strengths.description: Many units spread plague and disease that weakens enemies over time

strengths.name: No Food Required
strengths.description: Undead units do not consume food resources

strengths.name: Blight Regeneration
strengths.description: All undead units regenerate health while standing on blight

strengths.name: Fearless
strengths.description: Undead units are immune to fear and morale effects

strengths.name: Endless Horde
strengths.description: Higher unit population cap due to necromantic efficiency

weaknesses.name: Holy Vulnerability
weaknesses.description: Takes increased damage from holy and light-based attacks

weaknesses.name: Slow Movement
weaknesses.description: Most undead units move slower than living counterparts

weaknesses.name: Blight Dependency
weaknesses.description: Buildings can only be constructed on blighted ground

weaknesses.name: Sunlight Weakness
weaknesses.description: Some units take damage or are weakened during daylight

weaknesses.name: Fire Vulnerability
weaknesses.description: Takes increased damage from fire-based attacks

corpseSystem.description: Corpses remain on the battlefield and can be consumed or raised as new units

blightSystem.description: Undead buildings spread blight which heals friendly units and enables construction

unholyArmor.description: Undead armor reduces ice damage but increases vulnerability to holy and fire

necromancy.description: Fallen enemies have a chance to rise as undead servants

corpses.name: Corpses
corpses.description: Harvested from fallen units, used to raise undead

souls.name: Souls
souls.description: Captured from dying enemies, powers dark rituals

author: Vehement Development Team
